definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: Where shall we go to eat lunch today?
sentences.chinese: 我们该在哪儿吃中饭呢？

sentences.english: Back at Jimi’s centre we eat lunch and meet some local politicians.
sentences.chinese: 回到吉米的办公室，我们吃了中饭并见了几位政治家。

sentences.english: A: I‘m calling to see if you would like to have lunch tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我打电话给你，是想知道明天一起吃顿中饭怎样？

sentences.english: The train won't leave for an hour. Meanwhile we can have lunch.
sentences.chinese: 火车还有小时才开，其间可以吃中饭。

sentences.english: When after the midday meal you sat at the window reading Ramayana.
sentences.chinese: 当你吃过中饭，坐在窗前读《罗摩衍那》。

sentences.english: What are you making us for lunch today, Mousy!
sentences.chinese: “”今天中饭你给我们做什么吃的，小老鼠？“”

sentences.english: Back on board, it was soon time for an early lunch.
sentences.chinese: 回到火车上已经快到早中饭的时间了。

sentences.english: Faber contemplated going into the Great Eastern Hotel for dinner.
sentences.chinese: 费伯想去“大东方饭庄”吃中饭。

sentences.english: I'm calling to see if you would like to have lunch tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我打电话给你，是想知道明天一起吃顿中饭怎样？

sentences.english: In order to finish the interview manuscript, he didn't even have time for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 他为了赶写访谈稿，连中饭都顾不得吃。

sentences.english: We had lunch at the restaurant in the 44 South Village.
sentences.chinese: 我们在四四南村里的一家餐厅中吃中饭。

sentences.english: Some friends over lunch suggested this word.
sentences.chinese: 一些朋友过来吃中饭的时候谈到这个词。

sentences.english: Do you want to go to lunch?
After we corral the horses we'll have lunch.
sentences.chinese: 把马关进围栏后，我们就吃中饭。

sentences.english: We can fry up some of these pieces of cold meat for our lunch.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以把这些冷肉片煎一下作为中饭。

definition: to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
